content.question: Which of the following contributed most significantly to a surge in western settlement during the 1860s and 1870s?

choices.label: Dry seasons turned fertile land to semidesert and made real estate inexpensive.
A strong military eliminated attacks by Native Americans.
The expansion of railroads made the Great Plains more accessible.
The novels of romantics like Hamlin Garland glorified western life.
Government funding for irrigation projects made farms more profitable.

content.answer: The expansion of railroads made the Great Plains more accessible.
